docs.snippet: HOT SPRINGS, Va., June 5 (AP) -- Patty Berg battled cold and wind through two rounds of the $7,500 Triangle round-robin invitation golf tournament today to finish the fourth round of the 90-hole "plus and minus" event with a commanding lead of plus...
docs.lead_paragraph: HOT SPRINGS, Va., June 5 (AP) -- Patty Berg battled cold and wind through two rounds of the $7,500 Triangle round-robin invitation golf tournament today to finish the fourth round of the 90-hole "plus and minus" event with a commanding lead of plus 23 points.

headline.main: Miss Berg Leads by 23 Points in Triangle Round-Robin Golf Tournament; PAGE-SETTER GETS TWO 76'S FOR DAY Miss Berg Shows Way With 50 Points in Round-Robin Golf -- Mrs. Zaharias 2d

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, June 6 -- It is almost certain that the Organization of American States will meet by the end of this month to discuss the case of communism in Guatemala.
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, June 6 -- It is almost certain that the Organization of American States will meet by the end of this month to discuss the case of communism in Guatemala.
docs.abstract: Amer States Orgn (OAS) seen meeting by end of mo on Guatemala issue, reptdly in Montevideo; speculation; Latin-Amer views and reluctance on meeting noted

docs.snippet: Extreme dullness prevailed for the foreign exchanges during the abbreviated trading sessions of the past week. British pound sterling fluctuated narrowly while the Canadian dollar had a tendency to ease gradually lower.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 8 -- Secretary of State Dulles said today the United States favored a special inter-American meeting on the Communist threat from Guatemala. However, he added that a decision on such a matter must wait consultations with other...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 8 -- Secretary of State Dulles said today the United States favored a special inter-American meeting on the Communist threat from Guatemala. However, he added that a decision on such a matter must wait consultations with other American governments.
docs.abstract: Sec Dulles says US favors special inter-Amer meeting but will await views of other govts, news conf; discourages any Eisenhower-Arbenz conf on US-Guatemala problem; stresses US concern over Communist issue; CR Arab Facio says CR conf with neighbors on Central-Amer situation

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 9 -- Apparently confident of support by a majority of the other American republics, the United States is prepared to call for a meeting soon of the American Foreign Ministers on the Guatemalan situation.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 10 -- Delegates from Uruguay, Brazil and Syria attacked today legal provisions in South-West Africa that, they said, allowed punishment by whipping. The three countries are members of a United Nations committee that has...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 10 -- Delegates from Uruguay, Brazil and Syria attacked today legal provisions in South-West Africa that, they said, allowed punishment by whipping. The three countries are members of a United Nations committee that has been examining conditions in the territory administered by South Africa.
docs.abstract: Uruguay, Brazil and Syria attack laws permitting punishment by whipping

headline.main: WHIPPING SCORED IN U. N.; 3 Delegates Attack Practice in South-West Africa

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 12 -- The United States is expected to issue a call next week for a special hemispheric conference of foreign ministers on the threat of Communist-infiltrated Guatemala.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 12 -- The United States is expected to issue a call next week for a special hemispheric conference of foreign ministers on the threat of Communist-infiltrated Guatemala.
docs.abstract: US seen calling foreign mins conf soon; tentative resolution reptdly would urge Guatemalans to rid Govt of Communists

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: The last time the Foreign Ministers of the twenty-one American Republics held a special consultative meeting was in March, 1951, and the topic was the threat of communism from abroad. Next month the Ministers expect to convene again, this time to...
docs.lead_paragraph: The last time the Foreign Ministers of the twenty-one American Republics held a special consultative meeting was in March, 1951, and the topic was the threat of communism from abroad. Next month the Ministers expect to convene again, this time to discuss the threat of communism from within the hemisphere. The danger spot is Guatemala.
